title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 1, ch. IV, subch. B - GRADING OF MAPLE PRODUCTS
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. tit. 1, ch. IV, subch. B - GRADING OF MAPLE PRODUCTS
State Regulations

Part 175 - Repealed

Part 176 - Standards For Grading Maple Sugar (Repealed)

Part 177 - Repealed

Part 178 - Repealed

Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes
R. & Regs. tit. 1, ch. IV, subch. B
By order of the commissioner, the amended rules and
regulations in this Subchapter, filed Oct. 1, 1980, shall take effect on

January 1, 1981. However, existing stocks of labeled containers for maple syrup
may be used for direct sales to consumers at the place of production or the
producer's roadside stand until January 1, 1982. Since the labeling
requirements of these revised regulations have already gone into effect under

Federal regulations, the voluntary use of maple syrup containers labeled in
accordance with these revised New York State regulations is permitted prior to

January 1, 1981. State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
